table.SQL_SELECT_LIST:
set nocount on
select Setting_ID as [id] into #tbl from wcms_Setting where Setting_R is null OR Setting_R in ( select [Data] from [dbo].[F_001_StringToTable]('{@UserRole}', ',') )
declare @totalItem int, @totalPage int set @totalItem = ( select count(0) from wcms_Setting left join #tbl on [Setting_ID] = [id] where { Setting_Name <o> @Search:Setting_Name and } { Setting_Content <o> @Search:Setting_Content and } Setting_SiteID in(0, @siteID) ) if (@pageSize < 1) set @pageSize = 10 set @totalPage = ceiling(@totalItem * 1.0 / @pageSize) if (@pageIndex < 1) set @pageIndex = 1 if (@pageIndex > @totalPage) set @pageIndex = @totalPage
select Setting_ID ,Setting_Name ,Setting_Content ,Setting_IsHtml ,Setting_SiteID ,0 as [locked] from ( select top (@pageIndex * @pageSize) ROW_NUMBER() OVER(ORDER BY {@Sort} {@Asc}) as [num] ,[Setting_ID] ,[Setting_Name] ,case when Setting_IsHtml = 1 then '' else Setting_Content end as [Setting_Content] ,Setting_IsHtml ,[Setting_SiteID] from wcms_Setting right join #tbl on [Setting_ID] = [id] where { Setting_Name <o> @Search:Setting_Name and } { Setting_Content <o> @Search:Setting_Content and } Setting_SiteID in(0, @siteID) ) tb where [num] between (@pageIndex - 1 ) * @pageSize + 1 and @pageIndex * @pageSize select @totalItem, @pageSize, @pageIndex
drop table #tbl
